column4: BRIEF-Capital Senior Living Says Q1 Same Store Sales Fell 2.6%

column4: Private equity firm TPG looking to buy Capital Senior Living: Bloomberg
column5: (Reuters) - Private equity firm TPG is looking to acquire senior living communities operator Capital Senior Living Corp, Bloomberg reported on Friday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.
column6: TPG has made several approaches for an acquisition, all of which have been rebuffed by Capital Senior Living, the report said.
column7: TPG declined to comment, while Capital Senior Living did not immediately respond to Reuters request for a comment.
column8: As of Thursday’s close, Capital Senior Living Corp was valued at $112.03 million, according to Refinitiv Eikon data.
column9: Capital Senior Living’s shares were up 20.6% in late morning trade on Friday.
